text:
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
dune 13, 1962
Mr# II* G* Burrows
Manager
WUGM
University of Michigan
Ann Arbor, Michigan
Dear Edi
Under separate cover I am forwarding to you four (4) tapes which are
samples of the series DiSBlXEFIMG# These tapes were forwarded to me
by our Washington office; the tapes are the property of the State
Department and are cleared for broadcast.
The series consists of twenty-six (26) twenty-five (25) minute
programs; the material consists of unrehearsed Interviews with
foreign Service Officers, and in some cases their wives, who at
the time of the interview had recently returned from posts abroad.
The programs have been carried by KMX, Los Angeles, KLZ, Denver,
the Wisconsin network, Voice of America (certain programs) and WCBS
Mew York which produced the series#
I have listened to these tapes and feel they are interesting and full
of information and thus are educational* However, I am concerned
about some of the shows becoming dated by the time we can get them
on the network which will be fall at the earliest* I do not know if
additional, newer programs are being produced, but I think not.
In addition to the shows being forwarded, interviews are available
Africas Congo (formerly Belgian), Congo (formerly French),
Central African Republic, Liberia, Sudan, Togo, and
Upper Volta;
Asia and Middle Easts Afghanistan, Pakistan, Turkey, Yemen;
Europet Spain, Soviet Union, Yugoslavia;
Far East* Indonesia, Fiji Islands, Japan, Laos, Thailand;
Latin Americas Boliva, Ecuador, Venezuela*
